comment: Your grade will depend on how much you participate. As long as you are present in class, do the homework assignments, and do the multiple and simple bonus opportunities she offers throughout the semester, you will succeed. Her tests cover info she's covered in class, and they are never too over-detailed with irrelevant details. Highly recommend her

THE BEST PROFESSOR AT KSU!! In any class you take with her, she understands that you are a student who has other classes and a life outside of school. She offers so much extra credit that you can miss a couple of assignments and not take the final. You are guaranteed an A if you keep up with the assignments (super easy).

One of the best professors at KSU in the biology department. I've taken her twice now, for immunology and bioethics. Her class does contain a lot of homework/assignments, but they are easy and straightforward. She is one of the most caring and understanding professors, and she really enjoys what she teaches no matter the courseTAKE HER!

Dr.S is no doubt an excellent professor. She is literally the only professor I've had here at ksu that actually wants their students to pass their class w/o struggle. This was a hybrid class as well. I've taken her for 3 of my classes and i've gotten an A in all so that should say ALOT. Def recommend taking her for an Bio courses here at ksu!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I love her. She's the best professor I've had in my 4 years of being here at this university. Please give her a raise!!! She is great. She supports her students and makes sure they understand the content by giving multiple bonuses and extra credit opportunities. She is so sweet, I hope she gets everything she deserves in life

She truly cares about his students and is always available to help! The class is not hard, but she has clearly done her best to get people through the class as well as possible, and there are plenty of opportunities to get extra credits.

Dr. Schreiner is truly one of the best professors at KSU. She's super knowledgeable and passionate about what she's teaching and wants to make sure you succeed. Attendance is only mandatory on days when there are Journal clubs and Kahoots (1 per unit), but other than that, she records lectures and uploads them. Many opportunities for extra credit!

i wish i could take dr. schreiner for every class tbh. i had her for immunology and bioethics; you have a TON of opportunities to bump up your grade, and her lectures are pretty engaging. you're gonna have to work hard (like you would for any other class lol), but she will help if you reach out to her. do yourself a favor and take her class!!

Best professor in the Biology department hands down. She is incredibly caring, knowledgable, and patient. Her grading is incredibly forgiving (not test-heavy). Attendance is required in the sense that their are occasional in-class assignments that you risk missing points for, but they can be made up easily.

HW is alittle tedious. exam questions come from kahoots and lecture slides. super understanding and caring professor. offers ALOT of extra credit. Made a 70% on one exam and still ended with a 98% on one unit. Almost impossible to get anything lower than an A in this class if you at least try assignments!

She is the best for immunology, bioethics, and cell bio. I have done so good in all of her classes. Her grading works to where if you bomb exams, don't worry she's got other assignments lined up with each unit and it makes it so much easier to get a good grade. Best professor at KSU

Took her for Bioethics (dif course #). Hands down easiest prof ever. This class is very fun and has a lot of busy work, but nothing that isn't gonna take you more than an hour each work. She's caring and straightforward w/ expectations.

Dr. S has shown herself to be one of the best professors I've had during my college career. She's super caring, makes concepts very graspable, and seems to really wanna help you be successful. I wish my professors would take the time and energy to do what she does. Great experience overall!

Dr. Schreiner is a wonderful and caring professor. She made Cell Bio & Immunology easy to understand and not stressful. Lets students ask questions without hesitation. Great for summer classes as well. She has engaging journal clubs and in-class activities which help with learning the material. A top professor at KSU.

BEST PROFESSOR AT KSU. She is kind and does a great job teaching the material while being engaging and concise. If you do all her assignments and go to class, you should not have an issue. Unlike some professors, I never feel like I can't ask her a question about the material. She is so kind about asking questions.

This course is a Bloom's Taxonomy level 5. Coverage of complex topics includes low-stakes quiz responses used to track understanding. Incorporating relevant research journal articles expands comprehension and models for ongoing journal research projects (4). Dr. S consistently brings study tips and aides while pacing the course for comprehension.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Schreiner is the best at KSU, she teaches what you need to know. Tests are very easy, multiple assignments that need to be done on time but also easy if you listen to her in class. Quick answers emails and she wants you to great in the class, definitely take her if you have a spot!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I had her for Cell Bio and Immunology. She is AMAZING! Hands down best BIO professor at KSU! Very understanding, accessible, friendly, fun, and makes the material very digestible. Lots of opportunities to make up points. Material is broken up so ~6 tests but they're very manageable! Wish all professors had her teaching/testing style. TAKE HER!!!

I highly recommend her for Immunology. Her class was a breeze. If you study the quizzes and the kahoot before tests you'll get an easy A. She wants you to do well, so lots of the grades and projects are very straight forward and easily graded. She goes over key slides, answers questions, and does journal clubs during class, not lecture slides

High marks will require studying at a level 4 Bloom's Taxonomy. Foundation in biology and genetics will benefit you as you work your way through Essential Cell Bio. textbook. Dr. S is incredibly organized and will pace the dense material at an even tempo as she makes the material come alive and relevant with assignments, labs & lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I'm taking Biology 3300 Lab (Genetics Lab) right now and Professor Schreiner is by far the best professor I've ever had at KSU. Any questions you have, she will answer them without hesitation and will help you in the lab if you're stuck. PS, she goes over everything you have to do before starting. I'm taking her for Cell Bio as well as Immunology.

SWEETEST PROFESSOR EVER. Understand tests anxiety, so tests are very similar to quizzes and kahoots. Super understanding and caring and wants all students to make good grades. Allow for test redos and make-up work PLENTY of times. LOVE HER.
she is the best professor !!! I lover her I took her cell biology class and also her immunology class very helpful and she really cares about her students and willing to listen.

Easy A because unlike most professors, she actually understands that tests are kind of a flawed system, and instead most of the grades are based on practical procedures that you would do in a real-life setting (lab). She made learning enjoyable. Great professor! No lockdown tests either, so tests were less nerve-wracking. Choose her!

I took her for cell bio, and she made the class insanely easy, her exams were the kahoot reviews and the quizzes, she talked everything out with you that you need to know, and if you need help literally just ask her and she will be accommodating. It was the easiest A ever.
